required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Saquinavir/Ritonavir in Liver-Impaired Patients With HIV Infection.
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Moderate Liver Impairment on the Pharmacokinetics of Saquinavir After Administration of Saquinavir/Ritonavir 1000/100mg BID in HIV Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This 2 arm study will assess the effect of moderate liver impairment on the pharmacokinetics of saquinavir and ritonavir at steady state following administration of saquinavir/ritonavir 1000mg/100mg po bid in HIV patients. Saquinavir/ritonavir will be administered concomitantly with 2 to 3 active nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors. The study will compare a group of HIV patients without known liver disease and a group with moderate liver disease. The anticipated time on study treatment is <3 months, and the target sample size is <100 individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time of Administration to 12 Hours After Dosing (AUC 0-12h) of Saquinavir (SQV) and Ritonavir (RTV)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.5 hr, 1hr, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 5hrs, 6hrs, 8hrs, 10hrs, and 12 hrs post-dose on Day 14
primary_outcome.description: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve (AUC) is a measure of the plasma concentration of the drug over time. It is used to characterize drug absorption. The pharmacokinetic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to 12 hours after dosing (AUC (0-12h) of SQV and RTV The AUC (0-12hours) was analyzed for SQV and RTV by non-compartmental methods, using WinNonlin.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of SQV and RTV
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.5 hr, 1hr, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 5hrs, 6hrs, 8hrs, 10hrs, and 12 hrs post-dose on Day 14
primary_outcome.description: The plasma concentration (Cmax) is defined as maximum observed analyte concentration. The pharmacokinetic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the maximum observed plasma concentration (C max) of SQV and Ritonavir RTV The Cmax was analyzed for SQV and RTV by non-compartmental methods, using WinNonlin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of SQV and RTV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.5 hr, 1hr, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 5hrs, 6hrs, 8hrs, 10hrs, and 12 hrs post-dose on Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: The Tmax is defined as actual sampling time to reach maximum observed analyte concentration. The Pharmacokinetic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the time of maximum plasma concentration of SQV and RTV. The Tmax was analyzed for SQV and RTV by non-compartmental methods, using WinNonlin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal Half-life (T1/2) of SQV and RTV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.5 hr, 1hr, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 5hrs, 6hrs, 8hrs, 10hrs, and 12 hrs post-dose on Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Terminal half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half. The Pharmacokinetic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the terminal half-life (T1/2) of SQV and RTV. The T1/2 was analyzed for SQV and RTV by non-compartmental methods, using WinNonlin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmin) of SQV and RTV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.5 hr, 1hr, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 5hrs, 6hrs, 8hrs, 10hrs, and 12 hrs post dose on Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Cmin is the minimum blood plasma concentration that a drug achieves. The Pharmacokinetic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the minimum observed plasma concentration (C min) of SQV and RTV The Cmin was analyzed for SQV and RTV by non-compartmental methods, using WinNonlin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Clearance After Oral Administration (CL/F) of SQV and RTV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.5 hr, 1hr, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 5hrs, 6hrs, 8hrs, 10hrs, and 12 hrs post dose on Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: The CL/F is the oral clearance; that is clearance based on oral bioavailability. The Pharmacokinetic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the plasma clearance after oral administration (CL/F)of SQV and RTV The CL/F was analyzed for SQV and RTV by non-compartmental methods, using WinNonlin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution (Vd) of SQV and RTV
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.5 hr, 1hr, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 5hrs, 6hrs, 8hrs, 10hrs, and 12 hrs post dose on Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Vd is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. The pharmacokinetic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the Vd of SQV and RTV The Vd was analyzed for SQV and RTV by non-compartmental methods, using WinNonlin.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening (Day -35 to -1), pre-dose on Day 8, Day 14 and at follow up (Day 28-Day 35)
secondary_outcome.description: The pharmacodynamic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the cluster of differentiation 4 (CD4) count in participants in each group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Indicated Grade 3 and Grade 4 Laboratory Parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory parameters specified in Clinical Operating Guidelines (COG) were summarized. AIDS Clinical Trial Group (ACTG) and American Heart Association (AHA) criteria were used to grade COG laboratory test values. Laboratory parameters for which an increase to Grade 3 (G3) or Grade 4 (G4) occurred are presented in the table below.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number Participants With Abnormal Vital Signs
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormal Vital signs included are high and low Pulse rate (PR), high and how Temperature (Temp), high and low Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) and high and low Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP). Vital signs (SBP, DBP, PR,Temp) were measured after participants were in a semi-supine position for at least 5 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormal ECG findings included are high and low Heart Rate (HRT), high and low PQ/PR interval (PQ/PR), high and low QRS interval (QRS), high and low QT interval (QT), high and low QTCB interval (QTcB), high and low QTcF interval (QTcF), high and low RR interval (RR), high and low T Wave, high and low U Wave, high and low ECG. The 12 Lead ECG was recorded after participants were in a semi-supine position for at least 5 minutes. Only participants with abnormal ECG findings are presented in the table below.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted from 12 September 2006 to 09 April 2009 at 3 sites in US and 2 in Canada.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Total 19 participants were screened. A total 9 participants with HIV infection with moderate liver disease (Group 2) and 7 participants with HIV infection with normal liver function (Group 1) were enrolled in the study. Participants in Group 1 were matched with those in Group 2 on the basis of age, gender, weight, and tobacco use.

group.title: Normal Liver Function
group.description: Participants with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and with normal liver function receiving saquinavir (SQV)/ritonavir (RTV) 1000/100 mg orally twice a day (BID) for 14 days.

group.title: Moderate Hepatic Impairment
group.description: Participants with HIV infection and with moderate hepatic impairment receiving SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg orally BID for 14 days.

group.title: Normal Liver Function
group.description: Participants with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and with normal liver function receiving saquinavir (SQV)/ritonavir (RTV) 1000/100 mg orally twice a day (BID) for 14 days.

group.title: Moderate Hepatic Impairment
group.description: Participants with HIV infection and with moderate hepatic impairment receiving SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg orally BID for 14 days.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time of Administration to 12 Hours After Dosing (AUC 0-12h) of Saquinavir (SQV) and Ritonavir (RTV)
outcome.description: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve (AUC) is a measure of the plasma concentration of the drug over time. It is used to characterize drug absorption. The pharmacokinetic profile for following 14 days of administration with SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg BID included determining the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to 12 hours after dosing (AUC (0-12h) of SQV and RTV The AUC (0-12hours) was analyzed for SQV and RTV by non-compartmental methods, using WinNonlin.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.5 hr, 1hr, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 5hrs, 6hrs, 8hrs, 10hrs, and 12 hrs post-dose on Day 14
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis population: All participants who adhered to the study protocol and had evaluable concentration data and PK parameters on Day 14.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With the Indicated Grade 3 and Grade 4 Laboratory Parameters
outcome.description: Laboratory parameters specified in Clinical Operating Guidelines (COG) were summarized. AIDS Clinical Trial Group (ACTG) and American Heart Association (AHA) criteria were used to grade COG laboratory test values. Laboratory parameters for which an increase to Grade 3 (G3) or Grade 4 (G4) occurred are presented in the table below.
outcome.population: Safety population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication (whether or not they were withdrawn prematurely) and had safety follow-up data were included in safety analysis.

reported_events.desc: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication (whether or not they were withdrawn prematurely) and had safety follow-up data were included in safety population. .All AE’s and SAE’s were collected following the first dose, as well as those that started prior to dosing and worsened on or after the first dose.

group.title: Normal Liver Function
group.description: Participants with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and with normal liver function receiving saquinavir (SQV)/ritonavir (RTV) 1000/100 mg orally twice a day (BID) for 14 days.

group.title: Moderate Hepatic Impairment
group.description: Participants with HIV infection and with moderate hepatic impairment receiving SQV/RTV 1000/100 mg orally BID for 14 days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor’s intellectual property rights.
